channel.title: Small request
channel.description:
I'm a bit too lazy to learn how to make a script in Simba, especially for such a small thing.
I'd need a script to use with a flash game. Basically, if an image is not seen, input a letter/key (let's say letter A). Pretty straightforward.
Would be really grateful if someone could make me the script for that. Plus that snippet of code could be easily reusable across many games just changing picture name/keys in it. (hint:hp bar becoming too short & auto heal/panic button)

item.title: Small request
item.dc:creator: @Echo3 Echo_
item.description:
@Echo3 wrote:

It would look something like this:

[code=pascal]program ScriptForLazyDude;

const
XS = 0;
YS = 0;
XE = 0;
YE = 0;

var
Bmp, X, Y: Integer;

begin
Bmp := BitmapFromString(0, 0, ‘’);
repeat
if not FindBitmapToleranceIn(Bmp, X, Y, XS, YS, XE, YE, 10) then begin
WriteLn(‘Bitmap not found, pressing a.’);
SendKeys(‘a’, 300 + Random(100));
end else
WriteLn(‘Bitmap found.’);
until False;
FreeBitmap(Bmp);
end.[/code]

The arguments for BitmapFromString are specific to the image you want to find on the screen, so those need to be filled in. Also the constants are the screen coordinates that you want Simba to search for the image, so those need to be filled in too.
